Name: zhi mu
Other name: suan ban zi cao (蒜瓣子草)

Maladies Treated: yinxu (yin deficient) with afternoon fever and night sweating
bone-steaming tidal fever
toothache due to heat in the Stomach (胃火牙痛)
diabetes with heat syndrome (消渴)
edema
cough due to heat in the Lung (肺熱咳嗽)
two excretions not smooth (二便不利): difficulty in urination and defecation (constipation)
Medical Function: Nourishes Yin and clears fire (滋陰降火)
Moistens dryness and lubricates the intestines (潤燥滑腸)
Dosage:
10 to 20 g.
Concentrated Extract: 0.5 to 2 g.
Samples of Formulae:
suan zao ren tang 酸棗仁湯
bai hu tang 白虎湯
bai hu jia gui zhi tang 白虎加桂枝湯
Contraindications: Do not use in cases of diarrhea due to pixu (spleen deficient). Use with care for those who are prone to bleeding.

Rhizome: steroid type of saponin (固醇類皂甙)

References: [1] 《军事医学》2006年第04期 作者：李素燕; 赵振虎; 裴海云; 熊呈琦; 韩颖; 马百平; 毛秉智; 从玉文
Original Text:
zhi mu, Complementary and Alternative Healing University

zhi mu  知母   (in English and Chinese 中英文)  by: Joe Hing kwok Chu Click to see picture of herb.Pharmaceutical name:英文藥名﹕Anemarrhena RhizomeBiological name:拉丁文學名﹕Anemarrhena aspodeloidea Bunge.Pron. in Japanese:日語發音﹕chimoPron. in Korean:韓語發音﹕chimoPron. in Cantonese:粵音﹕zi1 mou5Other Names:別名﹕suan ban zi cao 蒜瓣子草, lian mu 連母Common Name:英文名﹕Common Anemarrhena RhizomeDistribution:產地﹕Mainly in Hebei, Shaanxi, Inner Mongolia, North Eastern Provinces.主產地區﹕河北, 陝西, 内蒙古, 陝西,東北。  Properties(characteristics)﹕性味﹕cold, bitter, sweet.性寒，味苦﹐甘。Channels (meridians) entered: 歸經﹕Medical functions:藥理﹕ lowers blood sugarantipyretic,sedativeantibiotictimosaponin AIII possesses anti-thrombotic effect [1]  降 血 糖 解 熱 鎮 靜 抗生素作用知母皂甙AⅢ有抗血栓形成的功效。 Actions & Indications:主治﹕yinxu (yin deficient)  with  afternoon fever and night sweating, constipation; toothache due to heat in stomach, diabetes with heat syndrome, edema, cough due to heat in the lung, constipation, and difficulty in urination..滋 陰 降 火 ， 潤 燥 滑 腸 ， 滋 腎 水 。胃 火 牙 痛 ,陰 虛 發 熱 , 骨 蒸 潮 熱 , 盜 汗 , 消 渴﹐ 肺 熱咳嗽﹐ 二便不利。。Chemical ingredients:化學成份﹕固醇類皂甙 (steroid type of saponin)，知

    糖體 ( xanthone C-glycoside ) ，芒果甙 ( mangiferin ) ﹐鞣質 (tannin)﹐粘液 (jelly)﹐烟酸 (niacin)﹐胆鹼 (choline)脂肪 (fat)。Daily Dosage:每日用量 ﹕10 to 20 g. Concentrated Extract: 0.5 to 2 g.10～20 克；濃縮中藥：0.5～2.克Samples of formulae:處方舉例﹕suan zao ren tang 酸棗仁湯bai hu tang  白虎湯bai hu jia gui zhi tang  白虎加桂枝湯Modern Research:現代研究﹕ Cautions:禁忌﹕Do not use in cases diarrhea due to pixu (spleen deficient). Use with care for those who are prone to bleeding.脾 虛﹐ 大 便 溏 泄 者 忌 用 。容易出血者小心應用。[1] Military Medical Journal, 2006, issue 4.[1] 军事医学》2006年第04期 作者：李素燕;赵振虎;裴海云;熊呈琦;韩颖;马百平;毛秉智;从玉文

Name: ju hua
Other name: Ye ju hua (野菊花; wild ju hua)

Geography: China: Zhejiang, Anhui, Henan, Sichuan, Hebei, Shandong provinces.
Huai ju hua (懷菊) is produced in the Huai Qing Fu area of Henan province (Jiaozuo).
Hao ju hua (亳菊) and Chu ju hua (滁菊) are produced in Anhui province.
Hang ju hua (杭菊) is produced in Zhejiang province.
Chuan ju hua (川菊) is produced in Sichuan province.
Ji ju hua (濟菊) is produced in Shandong province.
Maladies Treated: ju hua (chrysanthemum flower): liver and kidney deficiency (肝腎不足) with deficiency fire rising (虛火上炎) presenting with dizziness/vertigo (目眩頭暈) and blurry vision (視物不清).
ju hua (chrysanthemum flower): eye pain and dryness (眼睛澀痛).
ju hua (chrysanthemum flower): soreness and weakness of the lower back and knees (腰膝酸軟).
ju hua (chrysanthemum flower): tearing induced by wind (迎風流淚).
ju hua (chrysanthemum flower): photophobia/irritability in sunlight (怕日羞明).
ju hua (chrysanthemum flower): red, swollen, painful eyes (目赤腫痛).
ju hua (chrysanthemum flower): dim vision from prolonged visual strain (久視昏暗).
ju hua (chrysanthemum flower): central optic neuritis (中心性視神經炎).
ju hua (chrysanthemum flower): chronic glaucoma (慢性青光眼).
ju hua (chrysanthemum flower): neurasthenia (神經衰弱).
ju hua (chrysanthemum flower): retrobulbar optic neuritis (球後視神經炎).
ju hua (chrysanthemum flower): tinnitus (耳鳴).
ju hua (chrysanthemum flower): hearing loss/hard of hearing (耳聾).
ju hua (chrysanthemum flower): visual impairment (視力障礙).
Medical Function: Cardiovascular effect: dilates the coronary arteries by directly relaxing their smooth muscles.

Antibiotic effect (in vitro): effective against Staphylococcus aureus, beta-hemolytic streptococci, Escherichia coli, and Shigella spp.; the evaporating oil is identified as the antibacterial basis, with camphor and borneol as the main components. [1]
Antipyretic effect (animal experiment in rabbits): stomach infusion of ju hua extract lowered artificially induced fever; the effect is related to inhibition of the central nervous system.
Variant comparison: Ye ju hua (wild ju hua) shows better efficacy than ju hua in lowering cholesterol, lowering blood pressure, and inhibiting infection.
Dosage:
12 g ~ 18 g.
Do not boil for a long period because it contains essential oil which is an active ingredient.
Samples of Formulae:
Name: Qi Ju Di Huang Wan (杞菊地黃丸).
Application: swollen red eyes, sensitivity to wind and light (羞明), tearing with wind exposure (迎風流淚).
Composition: Shu Di Huang (熟地黃; Rehmannia root, prepared), Shan Zhu Yu (山茱萸; Cornus fruit), Huai Shan Yao (淮山; Chinese yam rhizome), Fu Ling (茯苓; Poria), Mu Dan Pi (牡丹皮; Tree peony root bark), Ze Xie (澤瀉; Alisma rhizome), Gou Qi Zi (枸杞子; Goji/Lycium fruit), Gan Ju Hua (甘菊花; Chrysanthemum flower).
Directions: Boil all herbs with water except ju hua, which is to be added to the hot liquid when ready. It can also be made into pill form.
Contraindications: Do not use in case of pixu (脾虛; spleen deficiency) with loose stools/weak digestion (便溏).
Research:
Modern research: High ratio of Zn/Cu is prone to coronary heart diseases. The Huai ju hua of Henan has a lower Zn/Cu ratio, which may be beneficial in preventing coronary heart diseases.

Study and report: ZHANG Jian; QIAN Da-wei; LI You-bin; YIN Zhi-qi. Funding: Jiangsu Natural Science Foundation (BK2001219); Jiangsu Public Interest Project (BM2004525). Affiliations: Jiangsu Provincial Academy of Traditional Chinese Medicine, Nanjing 210028; Department of Natural Medicinal Chemistry, China Pharmaceutical University, Nanjing 210009. The study isolated: chrysoeriol; luteolin; apigenin; chrysoeriol 7-O-β-D-glucopyranoside; luteolin 7-O-β-D-glucopyranoside; acacetin 7-O-β-D-glucopyranoside; acacetin 7-O-β-D-glucopyranosyl(6→1)-α-L-rhamnopyranoside; acacetin 7-O-(6"-O-acetyl)-β-D-glucopyranoside; acacetin; kaempferol; eupatilin; emodin; chrysophanol; physcion. Compounds 8–14 were reported as first isolated from ju hua. Source link: http://www.zhiti.cn/html/2008-12/242.htm

Compounds: chrysandiol (菊花萜二醇; chrysantemin A and B)

References: [1] Alvarez Castellanos P P, Bishop C D, Pascual Villalobos M J. Antifungal activity of the essential oil of flowerheads of garland Chrysanthemum (Chrysanthemum coronarium) against agricultural pathogens [J]. Phytochemistry, 2001, 57(7): 99.

Kwok Chu Click here to see picture of ju hua herb and plant. Pharmaceutical name:Flos Chrysanthemi MorifoliiBiological name:學名﹕Chrysanthemum morifolium Ramat.Pron. in Japanese:kikukaPron. in Korean:kukhwaPron. in Cantonese:kuk faOther Names:別名﹕干菊花 gan ju hua, 黃菊花 huang ju hua, 杭菊花 hang ju hua, 白菊花 bai ju hua。Common Name:常用英文名﹕chrysanthemum flowerDistribution:產地﹕Zhejiang, Anhui, Henan, Sichuan, Hebei, Shandong provinces of China.Huai ju hua is produced in Huai Qing Fu area of Henan province.Hao ju hua and chu ju hua is produced in Anhui province.Hang ju hua is produced in Zhejiang province.Chuan ju hua is produced in Sichuan province.Ji ju hua is produce in Shandong province.浙江，安徽，河南，四川，河北，山東。懷菊產於河南焦作（懷慶府）一帶。亳菊、滁菊 産於安徽的。杭菊產於浙江。川菊產於四川。濟菊產於山東。Properties (characteristics):性 味:sweet, bitter, slightly cold.味甘苦，性微寒 。Channels (meridians) entered: 歸經﹕liver, lungs.歸肝、肺經 。Actions & Indications:主治﹕For liver and kidney deficiency resulting in dizziness, blurry vision, pain and weakness in lower back and knees, tears induced by wind blowing, eyes are irritable in sunlight, chronic glaucoma, neurasthenia, ringing in the ears, hard in hearing, weak eye sight.治肝腎不足，虛火上炎所致的目眩頭暈，視物不清，眼睛澀 痛，腰膝酸軟，迎風流淚等證。目赤腫痛、久視昏暗、迎風流淚、怕日羞明、中心性視神經炎、慢性青光眼、神經衰弱、球後視神經炎、耳鳴耳聾、 視力障礙等。 Medical function:藥理作用﹕Effect on cardio-vascular system: it has obvious effect on dilating the coronary arteries by directly relaxing their smooth muscles.Anti-inflammatory effectAntibiotic effect: in vitro experiment, ju hua possesses therapeutic effect on infections caused by staphylococcus aureaus, beta hemolytic streptococci, escherichia coli, and Shigella spp. There are studies [1] that discovered it is the evaporating oil of ju hua that possess the antibiotic effect. Camphor and borneol are the main ingredients.Antipyretic effect: stomach infusion of ju hua extra to rabbits that were induced fever artificially showed it has antipyretic effect. The result can be the inhibiting effect on the CNS.Ye ju hua (wild ju hua) is better than ju hua in lowering cholesterol, lowering blood pressure and inhibit infection. 對心血管系統的影響: 有明顯的擴張冠狀動脈的作用，是直接鬆弛冠狀動脈的平滑肌所致。抗 炎。抗病原微生 物的作用: 體外試驗，對金黃色葡萄球菌、乙型溶血性鏈球菌、大腸桿菌、痢疾桿菌有 療效。抑菌作用現有研究認為［1］ 揮發油是菊花抗菌作用的物質基礎，其中的樟腦、龍腦則是其發揮抗菌作用的主要成分。解熱作用: 菊花浸膏灌胃，對人工發熱的家兔有解熱的作用，其作用是對中樞神經系統 的抑制有關。野菊花對於降低膽固醇、降血壓、抑制感染三方面療效優於菊花。Samples of formulae:處方舉例﹕Name of formula: qi ju di huang wanApplication: swollen red eyes, sensitive to blowing of wind and light.Composition: shu di huang, shan zhu yu, huai shan yao, fu ling  , mu dan pi, ze xie  , gou qi z, ju hua.Boil all herb with water except ju hua which is to be added to the hot liquid when ready. It can also made into pill form. 藥方名：杞菊地黃丸  《小兒藥證直訣》【主治】    主治：目赤腫痛，迎風流淚，羞明症。【組成】    組成：熟 地 黃 、山 茱 萸、 淮 山 、茯 苓、 牡 丹皮 、澤 瀉、枸 杞 子、 甘菊花 。 modern research:現代研究：High ration of Zn/Cu is prone to coronary heart diseases. The Huai ju hua of Henan has a lower Zn/Cu ratio which may be beneficial in preventing coronary heart diseases.河南懷菊花中Zn/Cu比值较低，可能對防止冠心病有利。高比值較易患冠心病。Chemical ingredients:化學成份﹕化學成份﹕Chemical ingredients:腺嘌呤 (adenine)膽鹼  (choline)水蘇鹼  (stachydrine)菊红甙  (chrysanthemin,維 生素  (B1 vitamin B1)芹菜素  (apigenin)  刺槐素  (acacetin)黃連甙 I  (coptiside I)菊花萜二醇  (chrysandiol)(chrysantemin A and B)氯菊素  (chlorochrymorin)龍腦, (camphor)樟腦 (borneol)The following is from:Study and report of: ZHANG Jian,  QIAN Da-wei, LI You-bin, YIN Zhi-qi　  基金項目：江蘇省自然科學基金項目(BK2001219);江蘇省公益項目(BM2004525) 作者簡介：張健,通訊作者86-25-85639644;E-mail:zjwonderful@hotmail.com 作者單位：張健（江蘇省中醫藥研究院,南京,210028）　 　　　　　錢大瑋（江蘇省中醫藥研究院,南京,210028）　 　　　　　李友賓（江蘇省中醫藥研究院,南京,210028）　 　　　　　殷志琦（中國藥科大學天然藥物化學教研室,南京,210009）　1. 香葉 木素(chrysoeriol),2. 木犀 草素(luteolin),3. 芹菜 素 (apigenin),4. 香葉 木素7-O-β-D-葡萄糖苷(chrysoeriol 7-O-β-D-glucopyranoside,4),5. 木犀 草素7-O-β-D-葡萄糖苷(luteolin 7-O-β-D-glucopyranoside,5),6. 金合 歡素7-O-β-D-葡萄糖苷(acacetin 7-O-β-D-glucopyranoside,6),7. 刺槐 苷(acacetin 7-O-β-D-glucopyranosyl(6→1)-α-L-rhamnopy-ranoside,7),8. 金合 歡素7-O-(6\"-O-乙酰)-β -D-葡萄糖苷(acacetin 7-O-(6\"-O-acetyl)-β-D-glucopyranoside,8),9. .金 合歡素(acacetin,9),10. 山 奈(kaempferol, 10),11. 異 澤蘭黃素(eupatilin,11),12. 大 黃素(emodin,12),13. 大 黃(chrysophanol,13)14. 大 黃素甲醚 (physcion,14).其中化合物8～14均 為首次從菊花中分離得到.看 http://www.zhiti.cn/html/2008-12/242.htmDosage:用量:12 g ~ 18 g . Do not boil for long period because it contain essential oil which is an active ingredient.12克～18克 。不可久煎以避免損失有效的揮發油。Cautions:禁忌:Do not use in case of pixu (spleen deficient)/ weak digestion with loose stool.脾虛便溏者忌服。 中文藥理作用節錄自﹕ 陳俊哲中醫師 發表的【 中藥介紹－－菊花】[1] 菊花抗菌作用资料來源看下條：[1] Alvarez Castellanos P P, Bishop C D, Pascual Villalobos M J. Name: kuan dong hua
Other name: ba jiao ji hua 八角烏花

Maladies Treated: Cough due to coldness in the Lungs.
Cough due to heat in the Lungs.
Consumptive cough due to Lung deficiency (肺虛勞嗽).
Cough and asthma due to Lung deficiency; honey-fried kuan dong hua (flowers processed with honey) is particularly suitable.
Dosage:
Oral decoction: 2–10 g; or use in powder or pill form.
External application: appropriate amount; mash and apply to the affected area.
Samples of Formulae:
For cough due to cold in the Lungs or heat in the Lungs: Kuan Dong Hua San (Coltsfoot Flower Powder). Indication: lung cold cough; lung heat cough.

For cough due to weakness and consumption (Lung deficiency): Bai Hua Gao (Hundred-Flower Paste).

Zi Wan San (from Sheng Hui Fang): For chronic coughing nonstop. Composition: Zi Wan (Aster root) 3 liang, Kuan Dong Hua (coltsfoot flower) 3 liang. Preparation: make into coarse powder. Dosage: each dose 3 qian; decoct with 1 medium cup of water (about 350 c.c.), add Sheng Jiang (fresh ginger) 0.5 fen, simmer down to 0.6 cup; strain and take warm, 3–4 times a day. [1]

Modern weight adaptation: Zi Wan (Aster root) 90 g, Kuan Dong Hua (coltsfoot flower) 90 g. Make into coarse powder. Dosage: 9 g per dose; add Sheng Jiang (fresh ginger) 3 g. Boil with about 350 c.c. of water, simmer down to 60% of a cup, strain and take warm, 3–4 times a day. [1]
Contraindications:
Being acrid-warm, it easily disperses qi and assists heat; use with extreme caution for hemoptysis or Lung abscess with coughing up pus and blood.
Contraindicated for yin-deficient consumptive cough (陰虛勞嗽禁用).
Not to be used when Lung fire is blazing with heat scorching the Lung and Lung qi is burned and full (肺火燔灼，肺氣焦滿者不可用).
Compatibility notes from classical sources: Xing Ren (apricot kernel) acts as envoy for kuan dong hua; it works well with Zi Wan (Aster root). It is incompatible with Zao Jia (Chinese honeylocust fruit), Xiao Shi (niter/saltpeter), and Xuan Shen (Scrophularia root). It is antagonized by/averse to Bei Mu (Fritillaria bulb), Xin Yi (Magnolia flower), Ma Huang (Ephedra), Huang Qin (Baikal skullcap root), Huang Lian (Coptis rhizome), Huang Qi (Astragalus root), and Qing Xiang Zi (Celosia seed).

Leaves: ash contains zinc, up to 3.26% (computed with ZnCO3)

References: [1] Qian Jin Fang 千金方，出自聖惠方。
[2] Zhong Hua Ben Cao 中華本草

Japanese:日語發音﹕kantokaPron. in Korean:韓語發音﹕kwandonghwaPron. in Cantonese:粵音﹕fun2  dung1 faa1Other Names:別名﹕dong hua冬花，kuan dong 款冬 ，kuan hua 款花，ai dong hua 艾冬花，kan deng hua 看燈花，jiu jiu hua 九九花，tu xi hua 菟奚花，tu xi hua 兔溪花，ke dong hua 顆凍花，ke dong 顆冬，tuo wu hua 橐吾花，tuo shi hua 橐石花，hu xu hua 虎須花，kuan dong hua 款凍花，ku cui hua 苦萃花，shi dong hua 氏冬花，zuan dong hua 鑽凍花，ba jiao ji hua 八角烏花，xi dong hua 西冬花，zuan dong hua 鑽冬花。Common Name:英文名﹕common coltsfoot flowersDistribution:產地﹕Henan, Gansu, Shanxi, Shaanxi.河南，甘肅，山西，陝西。Properties characteristics)﹕性味﹕acrid, warm辛，温。Channels  meridians) entered: 歸 經﹕lung肺Medical functions:藥理﹕ cough arresting, phlegm expelling, asthma calming effectrespiration stimulating  effecteffect on cardiovascular system鎮咳、祛痰和平喘作用。呼吸興奮作用。對心血管作用。Actions & Indications:主治﹕cough due to coldness or heat in lungs.肺寒咳嗽,肺 熱咳嗽,肺虛勞嗽, 蜜炙款冬花,功偏潤肺止咳,尤宜於肺虛咳喘之證。Chemical ingredients:[2]化學成份﹕[2]Flowers contain:花含:faradiol款冬二醇rutin芸香甙0.36%arnidiol山金車二醇farfaratine款冬花素tussilagine款冬鹼14-acetoxy-7β-[3�-ethyl crotonoloxy]-notonipetranome款冬素14-acetoxy-7β-3�-ethylcrotomoyloxy]-1α-[2�-methylbutyryloxy]- notonipetranone甲基丁酰款冬素酯7β-[3�-ethyl-crotonoyloxy]-lα- [2�-methylbutyryloxy]-3,14-dehydro-Z-motomipetranone甲基丁酰3,14-Z-去氫款冬素酯Hyperin金絲桃甙0.28%triterpenoid saponin三萜皂甙tannin鞣質wax蠟evaporating oil揮發油taraxanthin蒲公英黃質Leaves contain:葉含:bitter glucoside red 2.63%苦味甙紅2.63％gallic acid沒食子酸springy rubber like substance彈性橡膠樣物質dextrin糊精mucilages粘液inulin菊糖phytosterol植物甾醇stearic acid硬脂酸palmitic up to 3.26% (computed withZnCO3)灰分中含鋅甚多，達3.26％(以 ZnCO3計)Fresh roots and stems contain:鮮根莖含:evaporating oil揮發油paraffin石蠟inulin菊糖tannin鞣質Roots contain:根含rubber 0.015%橡膠 0.015％bauerenol降香醇(鮑爾烯醇)Dosage:用量﹕taking orally, in decoction: 2 to 10 g; or in powder or pill form.external application: use appropriate amount, smash and apply. .口服煎湯:2~10克，或入丸散。外用適量；搗爛 ，敷患處。Samples of formulae:處方舉例﹕cough due to cold in lungs: kuan dong hua sancough due to weakness and consumption: bai hua gao肺寒咳嗽,肺熱咳嗽: 款冬花散For chronic coughing nonstop: zi wan 90 g, kuan dong hua 90 g. Make into coarse powder.Dosage: 9 g,  add sheng jiang 3 g. Boil with about 350 c.c. of water. Simmer down to 60% of a cup. Strain and take it while warm. Take 3 to 4 times a day. [1]肺虛勞嗽: 百花膏紫菀散：治久嗽不止:  紫菀三兩，款冬花三兩。上藥粗搗羅為散，每服三錢，以水一中盞，入生薑半分，煎至六分，去滓溫服，日三、四服。（《聖惠方》紫菀散）[1]Modern Research:現代研究﹕ Toxicity & Cautions:毒素與禁忌﹕use extreme care in cases of coughing out blood or pus. Not to use in case of chronic coughing with yinxu (yin deficient)  condition.It is used with xing ren. Beneficial to use with zi wan. It is incompatible with zao jiao, xiao shi, xuan shen, bei mu, xin yi, ma huang, huang qin, huang lian, huang qi, qing xiang.  款冬花為 辛溫之品,易散氣助熱,對咳血或肺癰咳吐膿血者慎用.《本草經 集注》："杏仁為使 。得紫菀良 。惡皂夾，消 石，玄 參。畏貝 母，辛 荑，麻 黃，黃 芩，黃 蓮，黃 耆，青 葙  。"《本草崇 原》："肺火燔灼，肺氣焦滿者不可用。" 《 本經逢原》："陰 虛勞嗽禁用。"[1] Qian Jin Fang 千金方，出自聖惠方。[2] Zhong Hua Ben Cao 中華本草   Search this siteProblems with website? Name: du huo
獨活
Botanical: Angelica pubescens Maxim. f. biserrata Shan et Yuan

Geography: Anhui, Zhejiang, Jiangxi, Hubei, Guangxi (A. pubescens Maxim. f. biserrata).
Maladies Treated: Wind-cold-damp painful obstruction, especially in the lower back and legs.
Sickness induced by wind-cold-dampness.
Dosage:
Internal (decoction): 3–9 g.
Or soak in wine.
External: make into alcohol extract or decoction; decoction wash.
Samples of Formulae:
du huo ji sheng tang 獨活寄生湯
jiang huo sheng shi tang 薑活勝濕湯
Contraindications: Do not use in cases of high fever without chill or in cases of yinxu (yin deficiency) with fever.
Original Text:
du huo, Complementary and Alternative Healing University











Complementary and Alternative Healing University

            Aug 27, 
            2013, 4:24 p.m. LAH





 
du huo 獨活
 
Edited 


        by: Joe Hing kwok Chu
 




Pharmaceutical name:
英文藥名﹕

Radix Angelicae Pubescentis



Botanical name:
學名﹕

Angelica pubescens Maxim. f. biserrata 
            Shan et Yuan



Pron. in Japanese:
日語發音﹕

dokkatsu



Pron. in Korean:
韓語發音﹕

tokhwal





            Pron. in Cantonese:
粵音﹕

duk6 wut6



Other Names:
別名﹕


xiang du huo 香獨活，da 
            du huo 大獨活。



Common Name:
英文名﹕

doubleteeth pubescent angelica root.



Distribution:
產地﹕

Hubei, Sichuan (A. pubescens); Anhui, Zhejiang, 
            Jiangxi, Hubei, Guangxi  (A.p. Maxim. f. biserrata)



Properties
(characteristics)﹕
性味﹕

slightly warm, acrid, bitter性微温，味辛、苦。




Channels (meridians) entered:
 
歸經﹕

kidney, bladder腎﹐ 膀胱。



Medical functions:
藥理﹕
 



anti-arthritis, inhibits pain, sedative effect
expand blood vessels, lower blood pressure

 

抗關節炎、鎮痛、鎮靜；
擴張血管、降低血壓。





Actions & 
            Indications:
主治﹕

for wind-cold-damp painful obstruction, 
            especially in the lower back and legsfor sickness induced by wind-cold-dampness




Chemical ingredients:
化學成份﹕

1. osthol, eremophilene, thymol, alpha-cedrene, 
            humulelne, p-cresol, beta-cedrene, guaiol, (1-isopropyl-4-methylene-7-methyl-1, 
            2, 3, 4, 4a, 5, 6, 8a-octahydronaphthalene), [2-methyl-4-(1, 1-dimethylethyl) 
            phenol] (dodecyl isopropyl ether), alpha-elemene, (trans-p-menth-2-en-7-ol), 
            (2-methyl-5-, (1, 5-dimethyl-4-hexenyl)-1, 3-cyclohexadiene), alpha-funebrene, 
            alpha-bergamotene, (7, 10-pentadecadiynoic acid), [4, 11, 11-trimethyl-8-methylene-bicyclo 
            (2, 2, 0) undec-4-ene], alpha-bisabolene, alpha-longipinene, alpha-patchoulene, 
            Elixeine, (5, 6-dimethyl-3a, 4, 7, 7alpha-tetrahydro-1, 3-isobenzofurandione), 
            ([Z, E] -4, 8, 12-trimethyl-3, 7, 11-tridecatrienoate), (4, 4-methylenebis 
            [2, 3, 5, 6-tetr-amethyl] phenol), beta-bisabolene, 2-cyclo-hexyl decane,  
            Isosericenene, -2(oxacyclohexadecan-2-one), (2, 3-diphenyl-2-cyclopropen-1-one), 
            (1-tetradecene), (methyl 2, 4, 6-trimethyl-decanoate), n-octane, (4-methyl-cyclohexanone), 
            2-methyloctane, n-nonane, alpha-pinene, alpha-terpinene, 3-methylnonane, 
            beta-pinene, myrcene, alpha-phellandrene, 3-enecarene, p-cymene, sylvestrene, 
            n-undecane, myrtenal, (4-methoxy-acetophenone, (alpha-copaene), beta-elemene, 
            neroliclol.2. angelol, bergapten, osthol, umbelliferone, scopoletin, 
            glabralactone, columbianadin, columbianetin acetate, columbianetin, 
            xanthotoxin, angelol-B.
3. angelic acid, tiglic acid.




Dosage:
用量﹕

normal usage in decoction: 3 to 9 g.external 
            use: make into alcohol extract or into decoction
內服入煎劑，常用量3 ~ 9 克；或浸酒。外用：煎水洗。




Samples of formulae:
處方舉例﹕



du huo ji sheng tang  獨活寄生湯


            jiang huo sheng shi tang 薑活勝濕湯




Modern Research:
現代研究﹕

 



Toxicity & 
            Cautions:
毒素與禁忌﹕

do not use in cases of high fever without 
            chill or in case of
            yinxu (yin deficient)
            with fever.高熱而不惡寒或
陰虛有熱者忌 
            服。

Name: zhi zhu cao
蜘蛛草
Other name: da ye qui zi cao (large leave ball grass)

Maladies Treated: Cough with thick phlegm
Chest pain
Pain in rib cage area caused by impact injury
Malnutrition of small children
Dosage: Fresh herb 3 to 9 g. Use less on small children. Make into decoction and take orally.
Original Text:
zhi zhu cao, Complementary and Alternative Healing University
